actr.task

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • actr.task.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DualChoicePRP, DualChoicePTS, PVT35min, PVT88hours, PVTdriver, U1Addition, U1Count, U1Semantic, U1Tutor, U2Demo, U3Sperling, U3Subitize, U4AlphaArithmetic, U4Paired, U5Fan, U5Grouped, U5Siegler, U6BST, U7Choice, U7Paired

    public class Task
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The core class for a task to be performed by an ACT-R model.

    This class defines the default task with no interface components; an instance of this task is used when no task is defined in an ACT-R model. To create a custom task, this class should be extended and the subclass should override relevant methods to define the functionality of the new task. For example:

    • To construct a custom interface, the new task subclass should override the Task() constructor to create new components and add them to the interface (after calling super() to ensure proper initialization of other settings).
    • To initialize a custom task when the model begins its simulation, the task subclass should override the start() method and perform initialization in this method.
    • To update the custom task during simulation, the task subclass should override the update() method, which receives the current time and can thus update the task accordingly. All calls to the update() must be scheduled in the event queue: one-time calls can be scheduled using the addUpdate() method, and periodic calls can be scheduled using the addPeriodicUpdate() method.
    • To perform final cleanup and/or analysis, the task subclass should override the finish() method and perform all finalization in this method.
    Author:
    Dario Salvucci
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • createTaskInstance

        public static Task createTaskInstance(java.lang.String taskName)
        Creates an instance of the given task named by its name string. The task name should be the combined package name and class name for the class that defines the task -- for example, "actr.tasks.mypackage.MyTaskClass".
        Parameters:
        taskName - the task name string
        Returns:
        an instance of the task

        public Model getModel()
        Gets the model performing the task.
        Returns:
        the model

      • analysisIterations

        public int analysisIterations()
        Gets the number of model iterations to perform during an analysis. This method can be overridden to specify the desired number of iterations. The default is 1.
        Returns:
        the number of iterations

      • analyze

        public Result analyze(Task[] tasks,
                      boolean output)
        Analyzes a batch of tasks and, if desired, outputs the analysis. This method can be overridden to accept an array of tasks (usually with a length equal to the number returned by analysisIterations()) and perform the desired analysis over the entire set of tasks. If the output parameter is true, the method can use getModel().output() to output the details of the analysis to the screen.
        Parameters:
        tasks - the set of tasks to analyze
        output - a flag indicating whether to output the details of analysis to the screen
        Returns:
        the analysis result

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the task.
        Overrides:
        getName in class java.awt.Component
        Returns:
        the task name

      • setModel

        public void setModel(Model model)
        Sets the model for the task.
        Parameters:
        model - the model

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the task. This method can be overridden to allow a custom task to initialize the interfaces and any necessary data structures.

      • update

        public void update(double time)
        Updates the task. This method can be overridden to allow a custom task to update the interface and/or other relevant data structures. The current model time is passed into the method as an argument.
        Parameters:
        time - the current time in seconds from the start of simulation

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Finalizes the task. This method can be overridden to allow a custom task to finalize any necessary data structures and/or perform relevant analysis on task performance.

      • eval

        public void eval(java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> it)
        Computes a task-specific evaluation. When the model calls for an evaluation using the !eval! operator, this method is called with an iterator containing the string tokens in the evaluation (including parentheses as separate tokens).
        Parameters:
        it - the token iterator

      • evalCondition

        public boolean evalCondition(java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> it)
        Computes a task-specific evaluation condition. When the model calls for an evaluation using the !eval! operator, this method is called with an iterator containing the string tokens in the evaluation (including parentheses as separate tokens).
        Parameters:
        it - the token iterator
        Returns:
        the boolean value of the computed condition

      • bind

        public double bind(java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> it)
        Computes a task-specific binding. When the model calls for an eval binding using the !eval! operator, this method is called with an iterator containing the string tokens in the evaluation (including parentheses as separate tokens). The returned value is then bound to the associated variable in the production rule.
        Parameters:
        it - the token iterator
        Returns:
        the double value of the eval binding

      • addAural

        public void addAural(java.lang.String id,
                     java.lang.String type,
                     java.lang.String content)
        Adds an aural sound for access by the aural module at the current time. The identifier should be unique for different sounds; if the same identifier is used, the new sound will cancel the previously scheduled one.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique name of the aural object
        type - the type of the aural object (i.e., the "kind" slot value)
        content - the content of the aural object (i.e., the "content" slot value)

      • addAural

        public void addAural(double timeDelta,
                     java.lang.String id,
                     java.lang.String type,
                     java.lang.String content)
        Adds an aural sound for access by the aural module at the current time plus the given time delta. The identifier should be unique for different sounds; if the same identifier is used, the new sound will cancel the previously scheduled one.
        Parameters:
        timeDelta - the future time ahead of the current time at which to schedule the event
        id - the unique name of the aural object
        type - the type of the aural object (i.e., the "kind" slot value)
        content - the content of the aural object (i.e., the "content" slot value)

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(Event event)
        Adds the given event to the model's event queue.
        Parameters:
        event - the event

      • addUpdate

        public void addUpdate(double timeDelta)
        Adds a call to the update() method at the current time plus the given time delta.
        Parameters:
        timeDelta - the future time ahead of the current time at which to schedule the event

      • addPeriodicUpdate

        public void addPeriodicUpdate(double timeDelta)
        Adds a periodic call to the update() method every timeDelta seconds.
        Parameters:
        timeDelta - the period of the calls to the update() method
